it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.view

Interface TurnView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CLITurnView, GUITurnView, VirtualTurnView

    public interface TurnView
    View object that observes a turn and manages the interactions with the user.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  TurnView.ValOrUndo<T extends java.io.Serializable>
      A wrapper class used to add the "undo" value to the type T.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TurnView.ValOrUndo<ActionType> chooseAction(java.util.List<ActionType> availableActions)
      Locks the current thread until the user has chosen an action among the given ones.
      TurnView.ValOrUndo<java.lang.Integer> chooseCardFragment(java.lang.Integer cardID, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> fragments, boolean forceChoice)
      Locks the current thread
      TurnView.ValOrUndo<PaymentReceiptData> choosePayment(PaymentInvoice invoice, AmmoSet playerInv, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> cardIDs, int fragmentToPay)
      Asks the user to choose a payment.
      TurnView.ValOrUndo<PlayerColor> choosePlayer(MetaPlayer metaPlayer, java.util.List<PlayerColor> legalPlayers, boolean forceChoice)
      Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a player among the given ones.
      TurnView.ValOrUndo<java.lang.Integer> choosePowerUpCard(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> cardIDs)
      Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a power up card among the given ones.
      TurnView.ValOrUndo<TilePosition> chooseTile(java.util.List<TilePosition> legalTiles, boolean forceChoice)
      Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a player among the given ones.
      TurnView.ValOrUndo<java.lang.Integer> chooseWeaponCard(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> cardIDs)
      Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a weapon card among the given ones.
      void endTurn(PlayerColor actor)
      Notifies that the game has finished asking the given player interactions, either ordinary turn or revenge power ups.
      void startTurn(PlayerColor actor)
      Notifies that the given player started a new turn.

    • Method Detail

      • startTurn

        void startTurn(PlayerColor actor)
        Notifies that the given player started a new turn. If a turn is already started, then further calls to this method will mean that the game is asking the given player a revenge power up.

      • endTurn

        void endTurn(PlayerColor actor)
        Notifies that the game has finished asking the given player interactions, either ordinary turn or revenge power ups.

      • chooseAction

        TurnView.ValOrUndo<ActionType> chooseAction(java.util.List<ActionType> availableActions)
        Locks the current thread until the user has chosen an action among the given ones.

      • chooseWeaponCard

        TurnView.ValOrUndo<java.lang.Integer> chooseWeaponCard(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> cardIDs)
        Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a weapon card among the given ones.

      • choosePowerUpCard

        TurnView.ValOrUndo<java.lang.Integer> choosePowerUpCard(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> cardIDs)
        Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a power up card among the given ones.

      • choosePlayer

        TurnView.ValOrUndo<PlayerColor> choosePlayer(MetaPlayer metaPlayer,
                                             java.util.List<PlayerColor> legalPlayers,
                                             boolean forceChoice)
        Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a player among the given ones.
        Parameters:
        metaPlayer - The meta player that will be bound to the chosen player.
        forceChoice - Whether the player has to be chosen or not.

      • chooseTile

        TurnView.ValOrUndo<TilePosition> chooseTile(java.util.List<TilePosition> legalTiles,
                                            boolean forceChoice)
        Locks the current thread until the user has chosen a player among the given ones.
        Parameters:
        forceChoice - Whether the tile has to be chosen or not.

      • chooseCardFragment

        TurnView.ValOrUndo<java.lang.Integer> chooseCardFragment(java.lang.Integer cardID,
                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> fragments,
                                                         boolean forceChoice)
        Locks the current thread
        Parameters:
        cardID - The ID of the weapon card containing the fragments.
        fragments - The selectable IDs of the fragment as specified by the card effect.
        forceChoice - Whether the fragment has to be chosen or not.

      • choosePayment

        TurnView.ValOrUndo<PaymentReceiptData> choosePayment(PaymentInvoice invoice,
                                                     AmmoSet playerInv,
                                                     java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> cardIDs,
                                                     int fragmentToPay)
        Asks the user to choose a payment. The user can reject the payment (returning null), or choose what to use to pay, among ammos and power ups.
        Parameters:
        invoice - The PaymentInvoice object representing the price.
        playerInv - An AmmoSet object containing the ammos that the player can use to pay.
        cardIDs - The ID of the power ups that can be used to pay
        fragmentToPay - An ID specifying what the user is going to pay.
        Returns:
